dialogue_turns.speaker: HostA
dialogue_turns.text: Nearly half of all marriages in Kazakhstan ending in divorce? That's a staggering number, but I'm not sure government intervention is the right approach here.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Nearly half of all marriages in Kazakhstan ending in divorce? That's a staggering number, but I'm not sure government intervention is the right approach here.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Last year, there were 61,080 registered divorces, which is nearly half of the 124,774 marriages recorded. As statistics show, every second marriage ends in divorce.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostB
dialogue_turns.text: Well, Justice Minister Yerlan Sarsembayev seems to think it's a full-blown crisis, and he's got the numbers to back it up—61,000 divorces last year alone.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Well, Justice Minister Yerlan Sarsembayev seems to think it's a full-blown crisis, and he's got the numbers to back it up-sixty one thousand divorces last year alone.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Kazakhstan is facing a crisis in family and marriage relations, Justice Minister Yerlan Sarsembayev said, citing official statistics. Last year, there were 61,080 registered divorces, which is nearly half of the 124,774 marriages recorded.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostA
dialogue_turns.text: But isn't divorce a personal decision? I mean, raising state fees just to make it harder feels, uh, punitive rather than supportive.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: But isn't divorce a personal decision? I mean, raising state fees just to make it harder feels, uh, punitive rather than supportive.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Previously, Mazhilis deputies in Kazakhstan proposed raising the state fee for divorce as part of amendments to the Tax Code, a move aimed at making the process more deliberate and less impulsive.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostB
dialogue_turns.text: I hear you, but they're also talking about 12,000 people in the alimony 'red zone'—that's a lot of kids potentially being affected financially.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: I hear you, but they're also talking about twelve thousand people in the alimony 'red zone'-that's a lot of kids potentially being affected financially.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Out of the total number, we must note that 12,000 individuals obligated to pay alimony have entered the 'red zone.'

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostA
dialogue_turns.text: True, the child support issue is serious, but criminal liability for non-payment? That seems extreme.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: True, the child support issue is serious, but criminal liability for non-payment? That seems extreme.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: And from a legal standpoint, the mechanisms in place—up to and including administrative and criminal liability—are being enforced.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostB
dialogue_turns.text: They did mention it's part of a comprehensive approach, not just penalties. The minister admitted enforcement alone won't fix things.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: They did mention it's part of a comprehensive approach, not just penalties. The minister admitted enforcement alone won't fix things.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: We believe that a comprehensive approach is needed from various government agencies to strengthen the institution of the family and protect the interests of children. However, we understand that this alone will not solve the problem, Sarsembayev said.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostA
dialogue_turns.text: Still, blaming the loss of so-called 'traditional values' feels like oversimplifying a complex social shift.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Still, blaming the loss of so-called 'traditional values' feels like oversimplifying a complex social shift.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: According to the minister, the traditional values that once defined Kazakh society are unfortunately being lost.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostB
dialogue_turns.text: Maybe, but when every second marriage fails, it's hard to ignore the ripple effects on families and communities.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Maybe, but when every second marriage fails, it's hard to ignore the ripple effects on families and communities.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: As statistics show, every second marriage ends in divorce.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostA
dialogue_turns.text: Do we know what's driving this trend though? Economic stress? Changing attitudes?
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Do we know what's driving this trend though? Economic stress? Changing attitudes?

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostB
dialogue_turns.text: The article didn't dive into causes, just that the government is looking at legal and financial levers, like those proposed higher divorce fees.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: The article didn't dive into causes, just that the government is looking at legal and financial levers, like those proposed higher divorce fees.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: The issue being raised today deserves special attention. Previously, Mazhilis deputies in Kazakhstan proposed raising the state fee for divorce as part of amendments to the Tax Code, a move aimed at making the process more deliberate and less impulsive.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostA
dialogue_turns.text: Right, but making divorce more expensive might just trap people in unhappy situations, which isn't great for kids either.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Right, but making divorce more expensive might just trap people in unhappy situations, which isn't great for kids either.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostB
dialogue_turns.text: That's a fair point. Maybe the focus should be on support services, counseling, things like that instead of just barriers.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: That's a fair point. Maybe the focus should be on support services, counseling, things like that instead of just barriers.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostA
dialogue_turns.text: Exactly. Strengthening families shouldn't mean making it harder to leave bad marriages.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Exactly. Strengthening families shouldn't mean making it harder to leave bad marriages.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostB
dialogue_turns.text: And with private bailiffs already involved in alimony cases, it sounds like they're dealing with the symptoms, not the root causes.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: And with private bailiffs already involved in alimony cases, it sounds like they're dealing with the symptoms, not the root causes.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Targeted efforts are underway with private bailiffs to address this.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostA
dialogue_turns.text: Hopefully they balance those enforcement measures with real, uh, preventative support.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Hopefully they balance those enforcement measures with real, uh, preventative support.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostB
dialogue_turns.text: For sure. It's a tough situation all around.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: For sure. It's a tough situation all around.
